snippet: The two recent Clinton Correctional Facility escapees are unlikely to be living lavishly now, but as the clock ticks, experts say, they are more likely to evade capture for a substantial period.
abstract: Prison escapees have many new ways of avoiding capture and starting new lives, including prepaid cellphones and credit cards and property ownership through anonymous corporations, but most are caught by making common blunders such as contacting old friends and family or returning to life of crime.
lead_paragraph: The two recent Clinton Correctional Facility escapees are unlikely to be living lavishly now, but as the clock ticks, experts say, they are more likely to evade capture for a substantial period.

headline.main: Life on the Run Still Offers Long-Term Fugitives Abundant Ways to Blunder
